headline: How Jefferies’ Upgrade on Resilient Sales Momentum Will Impact Tractor Supply (TSCO) Investors
summary: In late 2025, Jefferies analyst Jonathan Matuszewski upgraded Tractor Supply Company to Buy from Hold, citing Q3 comparable store sales growth of 3.9% and management’s expectation for further comparable sales gains in Q4 driven by higher transactions and average ticket size. The upgrade also spotlighted Tractor Supply’s resilient rural customer base and traction from growth initiatives such as new store openings and a recent acquisition, framing the retailer as a potential hedge against...

headline: Tractor Supply Company (TSCO): A Bull Case Theory
summary: We came across a bullish thesis on Tractor Supply Company on Max Dividends’s Substack. In this article, we will summarize the bulls’ thesis on TSCO. Tractor Supply Company’s share was trading at $53.66 as of December 1st. TSCO’s trailing and forward P/E were 26.46 and 23.98, respectively according to Yahoo Finance.
